channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Scaffolding a Student to Instill Knowledge
item.description: We propose a novel knowledge distillation (KD) method to selectively instill teacher knowledge into a student model motivated by situations where the student's capacity is significantly smaller than that of the teachers.

item.title: SelfDocSeg: A Self-Supervised vision-based Approach towards Document Segmentation
item.description: Document layout analysis is a known problem to the documents research community and has been vastly explored yielding a multitude of solutions ranging from text mining, and recognition to graph-based representation, visual feature extraction, \emph{etc}.

item.title: Poisoning Language Models During Instruction Tuning
item.description: In this work, we show that adversaries can contribute poison examples to these datasets, allowing them to manipulate model predictions whenever a desired trigger phrase appears in the input.

item.title: End to End Lane detection with One-to-Several Transformer
item.description: Therefore, end-to-end detectors like DEtection TRansformer(DETR) have been introduced in lane detection.

item.title: Boosting Weakly-Supervised Temporal Action Localization with Text Information
item.description: For the discriminative objective, we propose a Text-Segment Mining (TSM) mechanism, which constructs a text description based on the action class label, and regards the text as the query to mine all class-related segments.

item.title: SIMPLE: Specialized Model-Sample Matching for Domain Generalization
item.description: Moreover, our method is highly efficient and achieves more than 1000 times training speedup compared to the conventional DG methods with fine-tuning a pretrained model.

item.title: ISAAC Newton: Input-based Approximate Curvature for Newton's Method
item.description: We present ISAAC (Input-baSed ApproximAte Curvature), a novel method that conditions the gradient using selected second-order information and has an asymptotically vanishing computational overhead, assuming a batch size smaller than the number of neurons.

item.title: Part Aware Contrastive Learning for Self-Supervised Action Recognition
item.description: This paper proposes an attention-based contrastive learning framework for skeleton representation learning, called SkeAttnCLR, which integrates local similarity and global features for skeleton-based action representations.

item.title: TaskPrompter: Spatial-Channel Multi-Task Prompting for Dense Scene Understanding
item.description: Each task prompt learns task-specific representation for one task, while all the prompts can jointly contribute to the learning of the shared image token representations, and the interactions between different task prompts model the cross-task relationship.

item.title: Strengthening structural baselines for graph classification using Local Topological Profile
item.description: We present the analysis of the topological graph descriptor Local Degree Profile (LDP), which forms a widely used structural baseline for graph classification.

item.title: What Do Self-Supervised Vision Transformers Learn?
item.description: We present a comparative study on how and why contrastive learning (CL) and masked image modeling (MIM) differ in their representations and in their performance of downstream tasks.

item.title: Cross-Institutional Transfer Learning for Educational Models: Implications for Model Performance, Fairness, and Equity
item.description: We also find that stacked ensembling provides no additional benefits to overall performance or fairness compared to either a local model or the zero-shot transfer procedure we tested.

item.title: Efficient Edge Inference by Selective Query
item.description: Training a hybrid learner is difficult since we lack annotations of hard edge-examples.

item.title: Reservoir Computing with Error Correction: Long-term Behaviors of Stochastic Dynamical Systems
item.description: The prediction of stochastic dynamical systems and the capture of dynamical behaviors are profound problems.

item.title: Variational Inference for Bayesian Neural Networks under Model and Parameter Uncertainty
item.description: Bayesian neural networks (BNNs) have recently regained a significant amount of attention in the deep learning community due to the development of scalable approximate Bayesian inference techniques.

item.title: Bidirectional Copy-Paste for Semi-Supervised Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: In semi-supervised medical image segmentation, there exist empirical mismatch problems between labeled and unlabeled data distribution.

item.title: ZeroSearch: Local Image Search from Text with Zero Shot Learning
item.description: The algorithm's output is a list of images sorted in descending order of similarity, helping users to locate specific images more efficiently.

item.title: Discover and Cure: Concept-aware Mitigation of Spurious Correlation
item.description: Deep neural networks often rely on spurious correlations to make predictions, which hinders generalization beyond training environments.

item.title: On the Impact of Outlier Bias on User Clicks
item.description: We therefore propose an outlier-aware click model that accounts for both outlier and position bias, called outlier-aware position-based model ( OPBM).

item.title: Decomposition Enhances Reasoning via Self-Evaluation Guided Decoding
item.description: With the self-evaluation guided stochastic beam search, we also balance the quality--diversity trade-off in the generation of reasoning chains.

item.title: Learning Achievement Structure for Structured Exploration in Domains with Sparse Reward
item.description: We propose Structured Exploration with Achievements (SEA), a multi-stage reinforcement learning algorithm designed for achievement-based environments, a particular type of environment with an internal achievement set.

item.title: Calibration Error Estimation Using Fuzzy Binning
item.description: Neural network-based decisions tend to be overconfident, where their raw outcome probabilities do not align with the true decision probabilities.

item.title: Scaling Pareto-Efficient Decision Making Via Offline Multi-Objective RL
item.description: In this work, we propose a new data-driven setup for offline MORL, where we wish to learn a preference-agnostic policy agent using only a finite dataset of offline demonstrations of other agents and their preferences.

item.title: Image Completion via Dual-path Cooperative Filtering
item.description: Given the recent advances with image-generating algorithms, deep image completion methods have made significant progress.

item.title: Discriminative Co-Saliency and Background Mining Transformer for Co-Salient Object Detection
item.description: Then, we use two types of pre-defined tokens to mine co-saliency and background information via our proposed contrast-induced pixel-to-token correlation and co-saliency token-to-token correlation modules.

item.title: Learned Focused Plenoptic Image Compression with Microimage Preprocessing and Global Attention
item.description: Also, it achieves 18. 73% bitrate saving and generates perceptually pleasant reconstructions compared to the state-of-the-art end-to-end image compression methods, which benefits the applications of focused plenoptic cameras greatly.

item.title: Posterior Sampling for Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Despite remarkable successes, deep reinforcement learning algorithms remain sample inefficient: they require an enormous amount of trial and error to find good policies.

item.title: Hypergraphs with Edge-Dependent Vertex Weights: Spectral Clustering based on the 1-Laplacian
item.description: We propose a flexible framework for defining the 1-Laplacian of a hypergraph that incorporates edge-dependent vertex weights.

item.title: SoK: Pragmatic Assessment of Machine Learning for Network Intrusion Detection
item.description: Unfortunately, the value of ML for NID depends on a plethora of factors, such as hardware, that are often neglected in scientific literature.

item.title: Hierarchical Dialogue Understanding with Special Tokens and Turn-level Attention
item.description: We evaluate our model on various dialogue understanding tasks including dialogue relation extraction, dialogue emotion recognition, and dialogue act classification.

item.title: LD-GAN: Low-Dimensional Generative Adversarial Network for Spectral Image Generation with Variance Regularization
item.description: To surmount this limitation, we propose low-dimensional GAN (LD-GAN), where we train the GAN employing a low-dimensional representation of the {dataset} with the latent space of a pretrained autoencoder network.

item.title: Data-Driven Subgroup Identification for Linear Regression
item.description: To do this, simple parametric models are frequently used (e. g. coefficients of linear regression) but usually fitted on the whole dataset.

item.title: Semi-Infinitely Constrained Markov Decision Processes and Efficient Reinforcement Learning
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, we are the first to apply tools from semi-infinitely programming (SIP) to solve constrained reinforcement learning problems.

item.title: An Implicit Alignment for Video Super-Resolution
item.description: Video super-resolution commonly uses a frame-wise alignment to support the propagation of information over time.

item.title: TAPE: Temporal Attention-based Probabilistic human pose and shape Estimation
item.description: Existing methods ignore the ambiguities of the reconstruction and provide a single deterministic estimate for the 3D pose.

item.title: POUF: Prompt-oriented unsupervised fine-tuning for large pre-trained models
item.description: Through prompting, large-scale pre-trained models have become more expressive and powerful, gaining significant attention in recent years.

item.title: Fusion for Visual-Infrared Person ReID in Real-World Surveillance Using Corrupted Multimodal Data
item.description: For realistic evaluation of multimodal (and cross-modal) V-I person ReID models, we propose new challenging corrupted datasets for scenarios where V and I cameras are co-located (CL) and not co-located (NCL).

item.title: Leveraging Label Non-Uniformity for Node Classification in Graph Neural Networks
item.description: We introduce the key notion of label non-uniformity, which is derived from the Wasserstein distance between the softmax distribution of the logits and the uniform distribution.

item.title: Made of Steel? Learning Plausible Materials for Components in the Vehicle Repair Domain
item.description: We propose a novel approach to learn domain-specific plausible materials for components in the vehicle repair domain by probing Pretrained Language Models (PLMs) in a cloze task style setting to overcome the lack of annotated datasets.

item.title: AVATAR: Adversarial self-superVised domain Adaptation network for TARget domain
item.description: This paper presents an unsupervised domain adaptation (UDA) method for predicting unlabeled target domain data, specific to complex UDA tasks where the domain gap is significant.

item.title: LAVA: Data Valuation without Pre-Specified Learning Algorithms
item.description: (1) We develop a proxy for the validation performance associated with a training set based on a non-conventional class-wise Wasserstein distance between the training and the validation set.

item.title: An Empirical Study of Multimodal Model Merging
item.description: Model merging (e. g., via interpolation or task arithmetic) fuses multiple models trained on different tasks to generate a multi-task solution.

item.title: Dense Hybrid Proposal Modulation for Lane Detection
item.description: In addition to the shape and location constraints, we design a quality-aware classification loss to adaptively supervise each positive proposal so that the discriminative power can be further boosted.

item.title: CCpdf: Building a High Quality Corpus for Visually Rich Documents from Web Crawl Data
item.description: In recent years, the field of document understanding has progressed a lot.

item.title: Knowledge-refined Denoising Network for Robust Recommendation
item.description: Knowledge graph (KG), which contains rich side information, becomes an essential part to boost the recommendation performance and improve its explainability.

item.title: SGAligner : 3D Scene Alignment with Scene Graphs
item.description: We propose SGAligner, the first method for aligning pairs of 3D scene graphs that is robust to in-the-wild scenarios (ie, unknown overlap -- if any -- and changes in the environment).

item.title: Information Redundancy and Biases in Public Document Information Extraction Benchmarks
item.description: Advances in the Visually-rich Document Understanding (VrDU) field and particularly the Key-Information Extraction (KIE) task are marked with the emergence of efficient Transformer-based approaches such as the LayoutLM models.

item.title: CED: Catalog Extraction from Documents
item.description: To address this problem, we build a large manually annotated corpus, which is the first dataset for the Catalog Extraction from Documents (CED) task.

item.title: SGED: A Benchmark dataset for Performance Evaluation of Spiking Gesture Emotion Recognition
item.description: Moreover, we propose a pseudo dual-flow network based on this dataset, and verify the application potential of this dataset in the affective computing community.

item.title: A feature selection method based on Shapley values robust to concept shift in regression
item.description: Feature selection is one of the most relevant processes in any methodology for creating a statistical learning model.
